result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac John Rayfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaac John Rayfield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaac John Rayfield was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Daniel Chapman, DF: Isaac John Rayfield appeared.  Court called at 9:36 a.m. Set for SEHR.  ADA Nieskes makes recommendation.  Attorney Chapman agrees with recommendation.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:
       

14CF290 to run concurrent with 14CF335
- DE sentenced to 3 1/2 years 
- 1 1/2 years I/C
- 2 years E/S
- Credit for 383 days
- DE eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
- DE eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
- DE remanded to the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office to be transported to Dodge
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by Agent Volz. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared. Includes 14CF290, 14TR2803 and 14TR2804, 14CF335. There is an agreement. RE: 14CF290 - Court amends count one to 961.41(3g)(g) repeater is STRICKEN, class I felony possess of meth. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. 
Court reads AMENDED charge and possible penalties for count one in 14CF290. Court dismisses counts 2 & 3. Def pleads guilty to count 1, as amended.  
Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 14CF335 (Repeater is STRICKEN, class F felony delivery of meth). Def pleads no contest. 
Court dismisses count 2. Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1, as amended in 14CF290 and count 1, as amended in 14CF335. 14TR2803 and 14TR2804 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments. Court orders in 14CF290: S/W 3 years probation with conditions:
- 1 year in St. Croix County Jail with credit for 187 days time served. Eligible for Huber for seek work/work release. No good time.
- Court costs $518.00 ($268 + $250) Payable through probation.
- $400 in restitution to St. Croix County Sheriff's Office. Court approves that money being held at the Sheriff's office can be applied towards restitution. 
- No contact and not to associate with any persons known or supected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufactureing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- AODA and all recommendations
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- $1053.00 to SCSO; payable through probation. Clerk of Court to enter a civil judgment also. 

RE - 14CF335: I/S 7 years total sentence - 4 years Initial Confinement and 3 years extended supervision with conditions:
- No contact and not to associate with any persons known or supected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufactureing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Court costs $518.00. Payable through probation.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*3 years probation with the same conditions as 14CF290
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
Addition to filed by Atty John Kucinski. eif
*OFF RECORD* There is an agreement. Def to plead tomorrow at 9:00 am.
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Alexis McKinley.
Filed by Atty Kucinski. hml
